front.title: IEEE Draft Standard Test Access Port and Boundary Scan Architecture

author.organization: Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers

front.abstract: Circuitry that may be built into an integrated circuit to assist in the test, maintenance and support of assembled printed circuit boards is defined. The circuitry includes a standard interface through which instructions and test data are communicated. A set of test features is defined, including a boundary-scan register, such that the component is able to respond to a minimum set of instructions designed to assist with testing of assembled printed circuit boards. Also, a language is defined that allows rigorous description of the component-specific aspects of such testability features.
